cards.name: Academy Elite
cards.text:
Academy Elite enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it, where X is the number of instant and sorcery cards in all graveyards.
{2}{U}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Academy Elite: Draw a card, then discard a card.

cards.name: Advantageous Proclamation
cards.text:
(Start the game with this conspiracy face up in the command zone.)
Your minimum deck size is reduced by five.
cards.flavor: "The beneficent council deems you worthy of favor. They hope this doesn't provoke envy from your peers."

cards.name: Æther Searcher
cards.text:
Reveal Æther Searcher as you draft it. Reveal the next card you draft and note its name. 
When Æther Searcher enters the battlefield, you may search your hand and/or library for a card with a name noted as you drafted cards named Æther Searcher. You may cast it without paying its mana cost. If you searched your library this way, shuffle it.

cards.name: Æther Tradewinds
cards.text: Return target permanent you control and target permanent you don't control to their owners' hands.
cards.flavor:
"The wind smells of misfortune. Check your knots."
—Anitan, Ondu cleric

cards.name: Agent of Acquisitions
cards.text:
Draft Agent of Acquisitions face up.
Instead of drafting a card from a booster pack, you may draft each card in that booster pack, one at a time. If you do, turn Agent of Acquisitions face down and you can't draft cards for the rest of this draft round. (You may look at booster packs passed to you.)

cards.name: Air Servant
cards.text:
Flying
{2}{U}: Tap target creature with flying.
cards.flavor:
"Wind is forceful, yet ephemeral. It can knock a dragon out of the sky, yet pass through the smallest crack unhindered."
—Jestus Dreya, Of Elements and Eternity

cards.name: Ajani's Sunstriker
cards.text: Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
cards.flavor: "Ajani goes where he is needed most and in his name we keep his lands safe."

cards.name: Altar of Dementia
cards.text: Sacrifice a creature: Target player puts a number of cards equal to the sacrificed creature's power from the top of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"It is not that you will go mad. It is that you will beg for madness."
—Volrath

cards.name: Altar's Reap
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Altar's Reap, sacrifice a creature.
Draw two cards.
cards.flavor:
"Don't worry, your death will be as informative as possible."
—Gorghul, augur of skulls

cards.name: Apex Hawks
cards.text:
Multikicker {1}{W} (You may pay an additional {1}{W} any number of times as you cast this spell.)
Flying
Apex Hawks enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each time it was kicked.

cards.name: Assassinate
cards.text: Destroy target tapped creature.
cards.flavor:
"This is how wars are won—not with armies of soldiers but with a single knife blade, artfully placed."
—Yurin, royal assassin

cards.name: Backup Plan
cards.text:
(Start the game with this conspiracy face up in the command zone.)
Draw an additional hand of seven cards as the game begins. Before taking mulligans, shuffle all but one of your hands into your library.
cards.flavor: "In the market for an alternative, friend?"

cards.name: Barbed Shocker
cards.text:
Trample, haste
Whenever Barbed Shocker deals damage to a player, that player discards all the cards in his or her hand, then draws that many cards.
cards.flavor: Fervid shamans willingly submit to shockers in hopes of glimpsing the fortunes of the future.

cards.name: Basandra, Battle Seraph
cards.text:
Flying
Players can't cast spells during combat.
{R}: Target creature attacks this turn if able.
cards.flavor: "Why listen to the mumblings of wizards when the lash speaks true?"

cards.name: Bite of the Black Rose
cards.text: Will of the council — Starting with you, each player votes for sickness or psychosis. If sickness gets more votes, creatures your opponents control get -2/-2 until end of turn. If psychosis gets more votes or the vote is tied, each opponent discards two cards.

cards.name: Boldwyr Intimidator
cards.text:
Cowards can't block Warriors.
{R}: Target creature becomes a Coward until end of turn.
{2}{R}: Target creature becomes a Warrior until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Now everyone knows what you are."

cards.name: Brago's Favor
cards.text:
Hidden agenda (Start the game with this conspiracy face down in the command zone and secretly name a card. You may turn this conspiracy face up any time and reveal the chosen name.)
Spells with the chosen name you cast cost {1} less to cast.

cards.name: Brago's Representative
cards.text: While voting, you get an additional vote. (The votes can be for different choices or for the same choice.)
cards.flavor: On Fiora, no matter is settled until King Brago offers an opinion.

cards.name: Brago, King Eternal
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Brago, King Eternal deals combat damage to a player, exile any number of target nonland permanents you control, then return those cards to the battlefield under their owner's control.
cards.flavor: "My rule persists beyond death itself."

cards.name: Brainstorm
cards.text: Draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand on top of your library in any order.
cards.flavor: The mizzium-sphere array drove her mind deep into the thought field, where only the rarest motes of genius may be plucked.

cards.name: Breakthrough
cards.text: Draw four cards, then choose X cards in your hand and discard the rest.
cards.flavor: The ideas came flooding in so fast that they couldn't all be contained.

cards.name: Brimstone Volley
cards.text:
Brimstone Volley deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
Morbid — Brimstone Volley deals 5 damage to that creature or player instead if a creature died this turn.

cards.name: Canal Dredger
cards.text:
Draft Canal Dredger face up.
Each player passes the last card from each booster pack to a player who drafted a card named Canal Dredger.
{T}: Put target card from your graveyard on the bottom of your library.

cards.name: Charging Rhino
cards.text: Charging Rhino can't be blocked by more than one creature.
cards.flavor:
"Is it wrong to go straight for what you want? Sneaking is for cats and goblins."
—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight

cards.name: Chartooth Cougar
cards.text:
{R}: Chartooth Cougar gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
Mountaincycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Mountain card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)

cards.name: Cinder Wall
cards.text:
Defender
When Cinder Wall blocks, destroy it at end of combat.
cards.flavor:
"The smell of roasted flesh hung over the valley for hours."
—Onean sergeant

cards.name: Coercive Portal
cards.text: Will of the council — At the beginning of your upkeep, starting with you, each player votes for carnage or homage. If carnage gets more votes, sacrifice Coercive Portal and destroy all nonland permanents. If homage gets more votes or the vote is tied, draw a card.

cards.name: Cogwork Grinder
cards.text:
Draft Cogwork Grinder face up.
As you draft a card, you may remove it from the draft face down. (Those cards aren't in your card pool.)
Cogwork Grinder enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it, where X is the number of cards you removed from the draft with cards named Cogwork Grinder.

cards.name: Cogwork Librarian
cards.text:
Draft Cogwork Librarian face up.
As you draft a card, you may draft an additional card from that booster pack. If you do, put Cogwork Librarian into that booster pack.
cards.flavor: Why wait for answers?

cards.name: Cogwork Spy
cards.text:
Reveal Cogwork Spy as you draft it. You may look at the next card drafted from this booster pack.
Flying
cards.flavor: Paliano's creations provide ample opportunities to plot the downfall of a neighbor.

cards.name: Cogwork Tracker
cards.text:
Reveal Cogwork Tracker as you draft it and note the player who passed it to you.
Cogwork Tracker attacks each turn if able.
Cogwork Tracker attacks a player you noted for cards named Cogwork Tracker each turn if able.

cards.name: Compulsive Research
cards.text: Target player draws three cards. Then that player discards two cards unless he or she discards a land card.
cards.flavor: "Four parts molten bronze, yes . . . one part frozen mercury, yes, yes . . . but then what?"

cards.name: Copperhorn Scout
cards.text: Whenever Copperhorn Scout attacks, untap each other creature you control.
cards.flavor: Fangren spur may sound louder, but Viridian resurgents claim that the horn of the vorrac creates a truer, more inspiring note.

cards.name: Council Guardian
cards.text: Will of the council — When Council Guardian enters the battlefield, starting with you, each player votes for blue, black, red, or green. Council Guardian gains protection from each color with the most votes or tied for most votes.

cards.name: Council's Judgment
cards.text: Will of the council — Starting with you, each player votes for a nonland permanent you don't control. Exile each permanent with the most votes or tied for most votes.
cards.flavor: When its power is threatened, the council speaks with a unified voice.

cards.name: Courier Hawk
cards.text: Flying, vigilance
cards.flavor: The Orzhov started using hawks as messengers in order to bypass the many toll roads and bridges that dot Ravnica. Soon the service became one of their most profitable businesses.

cards.name: Crookclaw Transmuter
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Flying
When Crookclaw Transmuter enters the battlefield, switch target creature's power and toughness until end of turn.

cards.name: Custodi Soulbinders
cards.text:
Custodi Soulbinders enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it, where X is the number of other creatures on the battlefield.
{2}{W}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Custodi Soulbinders: Put a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Custodi Squire
cards.text:
Flying
Will of the council — When Custodi Squire enters the battlefield, starting with you, each player votes for an artifact, creature, or enchantment card in your graveyard. Return each card with the most votes or tied for most votes to your hand.

cards.name: Dack Fayden
cards.text:
+1: Target player draws two cards, then discards two cards.
−2: Gain control of target artifact.
−6: You get an emblem with "Whenever you cast a spell that targets one or more permanents, gain control of those permanents."

cards.name: Dack's Duplicate
cards.text: You may have Dack's Duplicate enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature on the battlefield except it gains haste and dethrone. (Whenever it attacks the player with the most life or tied for most life, put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

cards.name: Deal Broker
cards.text:
Draft Deal Broker face up.
Immediately after the draft, you may reveal a card in your card pool. Each other player may offer you one card in his or her card pool in exchange. You may accept any one offer.
{T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.

cards.name: Deathforge Shaman
cards.text:
Multikicker {R} (You may pay an additional {R} any number of times as you cast this spell.)
When Deathforge Shaman enters the battlefield, it deals damage to target player equal to twice the number of times it was kicked.

cards.name: Deathreap Ritual
cards.text: Morbid — At the beginning of each end step, if a creature died this turn, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"All who set foot in Paliano are pawns in someone's play for power."
—Marchesa, the Black Rose

cards.name: Deathrender
Decimate
cards.text: Destroy target artifact, target creature, target enchantment, and target land.
cards.flavor: Anarchy comes in many forms: social, individual, Gruul . . .

cards.name: Dimir Doppelganger
cards.text: {1}{U}{B}: Exile target creature card from a graveyard. Dimir Doppelganger becomes a copy of that card and gains this ability.
cards.flavor: "Fear not. Your life will not go unlived."

cards.name: Doomed Traveler
cards.text: When Doomed Traveler dies, put a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: He vowed he would never rest until he reached his destination. He doesn't know how right he was.

cards.name: Double Stroke
cards.text:
Hidden agenda (Start the game with this conspiracy face down in the command zone and secretly name a card. You may turn this conspiracy face up any time and reveal the chosen name.)
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell with the chosen name, you may copy it. You may choose new targets for the copy.

cards.name: Drakestown Forgotten
cards.text:
Drakestown Forgotten enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it, where X is the number of creature cards in all graveyards.
{2}{B}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Drakestown Forgotten: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Dream Fracture
cards.text:
Counter target spell. Its controller draws a card.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Creation is a paradox. It hatches from its opposite."
—Olka, Mistmeadow witch

cards.name: Echoing Courage
cards.text: Target creature and all other creatures with the same name as that creature get +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: A single seed unleashes a flurry of growth.

cards.name: Edric, Spymaster of Trest
cards.text: Whenever a creature deals combat damage to one of your opponents, its controller may draw a card.
cards.flavor: "I am not at liberty to reveal my sources, but I can assure you, the price on your head is high."

cards.name: Elephant Guide
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
When enchanted creature dies, put a 3/3 green Elephant creature token onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Nature's strength outlives the strong.

cards.name: Elvish Aberration
cards.text:
{T}: Add {G}{G}{G} to your mana pool.
Forestcycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Forest card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)

cards.name: Enclave Elite
cards.text:
Multikicker {1}{U} (You may pay an additional {1}{U} any number of times as you cast this spell.)
Islandwalk
Enclave Elite enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each time it was kicked.

cards.name: Enraged Revolutionary
cards.text: Dethrone (Whenever this creature attacks the player with the most life or tied for most life, put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
cards.flavor: When every right is voted away, only rage remains.

cards.name: Exploration
cards.text: You may play an additional land on each of your turns.
cards.flavor:
"Only when we journey into the unknown can we find the impossible."
—Cyrul the Wanderer

cards.name: Explorer's Scope
cards.text:
Whenever equipped creature attacks, look at the top card of your library. If it's a land card, you may put it onto the battlefield tapped.
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Extract from Darkness
cards.text: Each player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard. Then put a creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.
cards.flavor: If you want to wreak havoc above, sometimes it's best to look below.

cards.name: Fact or Fiction
cards.text: Reveal the top five cards of your library. An opponent separates those cards into two piles. Put one pile into your hand and the other into your graveyard.
cards.flavor: "Try to pretend like you understand what's important."

cards.name: Favorable Winds
cards.text: Creatures you control with flying get +1/+1.
cards.flavor: Long thought to be extinct, flocks of gryffs reappeared with Avacyn's return.

cards.name: Fires of Yavimaya
cards.text:
Creatures you control have haste.
Sacrifice Fires of Yavimaya: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Yavimaya lights the quickest path to battle.

cards.name: Fireshrieker
cards.text:
Equipped creature has double strike. (It deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Flamewright
cards.text:
{1}, {T}: Put a 1/1 colorless Construct artifact creature token with defender onto the battlefield.
{T}, Sacrifice a creature with defender: Flamewright deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor: Those who can't conspire, create.

cards.name: Flaring Flame-Kin
cards.text: As long as Flaring Flame-Kin is enchanted, it gets +2/+2, has trample, and has "{R}: Flaring Flame-Kin gets +1/+0 until end of turn."
cards.flavor: A flame-kin is always formidable, but feeding its fire with a sorcerous gift grants it the power to devastate armies.

cards.name: Flowstone Blade
cards.text:
Enchant creature
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Remember the fable of the elf who came upon a cave of gold. In trying to free the largest piece, she was crushed by its weight."
—Karn

cards.name: Galvanic Juggernaut
cards.text:
Galvanic Juggernaut attacks each turn if able.
Galvanic Juggernaut doesn't untap during your untap step.
Whenever another creature dies, untap Galvanic Juggernaut.

cards.name: Gamekeeper
cards.text: When Gamekeeper dies, you may exile it. If you do, reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a creature card. Put that card onto the battlefield and put all other cards revealed this way into your graveyard.

cards.name: Glimmerpoint Stag
cards.text:
Vigilance
When Glimmerpoint Stag enters the battlefield, exile another target permanent. Return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.name: Gnarlid Pack
cards.text:
Multikicker {1}{G} (You may pay an additional {1}{G} any number of times as you cast this spell.)
Gnarlid Pack enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each time it was kicked.

cards.name: Grenzo's Cutthroat
cards.text:
First strike
Dethrone (Whenever this creature attacks the player with the most life or tied for most life, put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
cards.flavor: "Their guards are soft, ready to welcome a sharp dagger."

cards.name: Grenzo's Rebuttal
cards.text: Put a 4/4 red Ogre creature token onto the battlefield. Starting with you, each player chooses an artifact, a creature, and a land from among the permanents controlled by the player to his or her left. Destroy each permanent chosen this way.

cards.name: Grenzo, Dungeon Warden
cards.text:
Grenzo, Dungeon Warden enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
{2}: Put the bottom card of your library into your graveyard. If it's a creature card with power less than or equal to Grenzo's power, put it onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Grixis Illusionist
cards.text: {T}: Target land you control becomes the basic land type of your choice until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "It's simple, really. If they can't find us, they can't kill us."

cards.name: Grudge Keeper
cards.text: Whenever players finish voting, each opponent who voted for a choice you didn't vote for loses 2 life.
cards.flavor: "Your defiance is noted."

cards.name: Guardian Zendikon
cards.text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land is a 2/6 white Wall creature with defender. It's still a land.
When enchanted land dies, return that card to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Heartless Hidetsugu
cards.text: {T}: Heartless Hidetsugu deals damage to each player equal to half that player's life total, rounded down.
cards.flavor: Hidetsugu held over a dozen oni in blood oath. At his touch, rocks scorched. At his word, cities burned.

cards.name: Heckling Fiends
cards.text: {2}{R}: Target creature attacks this turn if able.
cards.flavor: Their language may be a cacophonous agglomeration of chittering snorts and mad barking, but the message they send is all too clear.

cards.name: Howling Wolf
cards.text: When Howling Wolf enters the battlefield, you may search your library for up to three cards named Howling Wolf, reveal them, and put them into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

cards.name: Hunger of the Howlpack
cards.text:
Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
Morbid — Put three +1/+1 counters on that creature instead if a creature died this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Werewolves are an unholy mix of a predator's instinct and a human's hatred."
—Alena, trapper of Kessig

cards.name: Hydra Omnivore
cards.text: Whenever Hydra Omnivore deals combat damage to an opponent, it deals that much damage to each other opponent.
cards.flavor:
"We should learn from the hydra. It never plays favorites; it devours everyone equally."
—Thrass, elder druid

cards.name: Ignition Team
cards.text:
Ignition Team enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it, where X is the number of tapped lands on the battlefield.
{2}{R}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Ignition Team: Target land becomes a 4/4 red Elemental creature until end of turn. It's still a land.

cards.name: Ill-Gotten Gains
cards.text: Exile Ill-Gotten Gains. Each player discards his or her hand, then returns up to three cards from his or her graveyard to his or her hand.
cards.flavor: Urza thought it a crusade. Xantcha knew it was a robbery.

cards.name: Immediate Action
cards.text:
Hidden agenda (Start the game with this conspiracy face down in the command zone and secretly name a card. You may turn this conspiracy face up any time and reveal the chosen name.)
Creatures you control with the chosen name have haste.

cards.name: Infectious Horror
cards.text: Whenever Infectious Horror attacks, each opponent loses 2 life.
cards.flavor: Not once in the history of Grixis has anyone died of old age.

cards.name: Intangible Virtue
cards.text: Creature tokens you control get +1/+1 and have vigilance.
cards.flavor: In life, they were a motley crew: farmers, lords, cutpurses, priests. In death, they are united in singular, benevolent purpose.

cards.name: Iterative Analysis
cards.text:
Hidden agenda (Start the game with this conspiracy face down in the command zone and secretly name a card. You may turn this conspiracy face up any time and reveal the chosen name.)
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell with the chosen name, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Jetting Glasskite
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Jetting Glasskite becomes the target of a spell or ability for the first time in a turn, counter that spell or ability.
cards.flavor: The bolt struck with a flash, and there was a terrible sound, as of glass shattering, but the creature was unharmed.

cards.name: Kor Chant
cards.text: All damage that would be dealt this turn to target creature you control by a source of your choice is dealt to another target creature instead.
cards.flavor: Sacred rites repurposed to fight an ancient threat.

cards.name: Lead the Stampede
cards.text: Look at the top five cards of your library. You may reveal any number of creature cards from among them and put the revealed cards into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.name: Liliana's Specter
cards.text:
Flying
When Liliana's Specter enters the battlefield, each opponent discards a card.
cards.flavor:
"The finest minions know what I need without me ever saying a thing."
—Liliana Vess

cards.name: Lizard Warrior
cards.flavor: Don't let its appearance frighten you. Let its claws and teeth do that.

cards.name: Lore Seeker
cards.text: Reveal Lore Seeker as you draft it. After you draft Lore Seeker, you may add a booster pack to the draft. (Your next pick is from that booster pack. Pass it to the next player and it's drafted this draft round.)
cards.flavor: Each volume contains wonders.

cards.name: Lurking Automaton
cards.text:
Reveal Lurking Automaton as you draft it and note how many cards you've drafted this draft round, including Lurking Automaton.
Lurking Automaton enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it, where X is the highest number you noted for cards named Lurking Automaton.

cards.name: Magister of Worth
cards.text:
Flying
Will of the council — When Magister of Worth enters the battlefield, starting with you, each player votes for grace or condemnation. If grace gets more votes, each player returns each creature card from his or her graveyard to the battlefield. If condemnation gets more votes or the vote is tied, destroy all creatures other than Magister of Worth.

cards.name: Magus of the Mirror
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Magus of the Mirror: Exchange life totals with target opponent. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
cards.flavor: "Behold! The image of the enemy and all that she has. Trust your envy, and take it."

cards.name: Mana Geyser
cards.text: Add {R} to your mana pool for each tapped land your opponents control.
cards.flavor: The Quicksilver Sea hissed and bubbled at the indignity. The Vulshok shaman just smiled.

cards.name: Marchesa's Emissary
cards.text:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
Dethrone (Whenever this creature attacks the player with the most life or tied for most life, put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
cards.flavor: "The Black Rose doesn't tolerate weeds."

cards.name: Marchesa's Infiltrator
cards.text:
Dethrone (Whenever this creature attacks the player with the most life or tied for most life, put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
Whenever Marchesa's Infiltrator deals combat damage to a player, draw a card.
cards.flavor: "Secrets, like coins, are easy to steal."

cards.name: Marchesa's Smuggler
cards.text:
Dethrone (Whenever this creature attacks the player with the most life or tied for most life, put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
{1}{U}{R}: Target creature you control gains haste until end of turn and can't be blocked this turn.
cards.flavor: "Watch your head . . . and your back."

cards.name: Marchesa, the Black Rose
cards.text:
Dethrone (Whenever this creature attacks the player with the most life or tied for most life, put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
Other creatures you control have dethrone.
Whenever a creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it dies, return that card to the battlefield under your control at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.name: Minamo Scrollkeeper
cards.text:
Defender
Your maximum hand size is increased by one.
cards.flavor: The scrollkeepers never stepped an inch away from the doors of the Great Library, not even when the ogres and their oni masters swept through Minamo.

cards.name: Mirari's Wake
cards.text:
Creatures you control get +1/+1.
Whenever you tap a land for mana, add one mana to your mana pool of any type that land produced.
cards.flavor: The land drank power from the Mirari as though it had thirsted forever.

cards.name: Mirrodin's Core
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Put a charge counter on Mirrodin's Core.
{T}, Remove a charge counter from Mirrodin's Core: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Misdirection
cards.text:
You may exile a blue card from your hand rather than pay Misdirection's mana cost.
Change the target of target spell with a single target.

cards.name: Moment of Heroism
cards.text: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains lifelink until end of turn. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)
cards.flavor: "My faith is stronger than fang, claw, or mindless hunger."

cards.name: Morkrut Banshee
cards.text: Morbid — When Morkrut Banshee enters the battlefield, if a creature died this turn, target creature gets -4/-4 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Let go your grudges, or risk wandering the bogs forever in a murderous rage."
—Hildin, priest of Avacyn

cards.name: Mortify
cards.text: Destroy target creature or enchantment.
cards.flavor: Many who cross Sorin's path come down with a sudden and fatal case of being-in-the-way-of-a-millennia-old-vampire.

cards.name: Muzzio's Preparations
cards.text:
Hidden agenda (Start the game with this conspiracy face down in the command zone and secretly name a card. You may turn this conspiracy face up any time and reveal the chosen name.)
Each creature you control with the chosen name enters the battlefield with an additional +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Muzzio, Visionary Architect
cards.text: {3}{U}, {T}: Look at the top X cards of your library, where X is the highest converted mana cost among artifacts you control. You may reveal an artifact card from among them and put it onto the battlefield. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.name: Nature's Claim
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. Its controller gains 4 life.
cards.flavor:
"The timeless, tireless jaws of nature shall one day devour us all."
—Sildark, artificer of Omu

cards.name: Necromantic Thirst
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals combat damage to a player, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Noble Templar
cards.text:
Vigilance
Plainscycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Plains card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)

cards.name: Orcish Cannonade
cards.text:
Orcish Cannonade deals 2 damage to target creature or player and 3 damage to you.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Crispy! Scarback! Load another volcano-ball."
—Stumphobbler Thuj, orcish captain

cards.name: Paliano, the High City
cards.text:
Reveal Paliano, the High City as you draft it. The player to your right chooses a color, you choose another color, then the player to your left chooses a third color.
{T}: Add one mana to your mana pool of any color chosen as you drafted cards named Paliano, the High City.

cards.name: Peace Strider
cards.text: When Peace Strider enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.
cards.flavor:
"The Vanished must have sent it from beyond to aid us in this struggle."
—Kessla, Sylvok shaman

cards.name: Pelakka Wurm
cards.text:
Trample
When Pelakka Wurm enters the battlefield, you gain 7 life.
When Pelakka Wurm dies, draw a card.
cards.flavor: It eats what it wants to eat—which is anything that moves.

cards.name: Pernicious Deed
cards.text: {X}, Sacrifice Pernicious Deed: Destroy each artifact, creature, and enchantment with converted mana cost X or less.
cards.flavor: "Yawgmoth," Freyalise whispered as she set the bomb, "now you will pay for your treachery."

cards.name: Phage the Untouchable
cards.text:
When Phage the Untouchable enters the battlefield, if you didn't cast it from your hand, you lose the game.
Whenever Phage deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature. It can't be regenerated.
Whenever Phage deals combat damage to a player, that player loses the game.

cards.name: Pillarfield Ox
cards.flavor:
"May starving fleas birth a thousand generations on your stubborn hide, cow!"
—Bruse Tarl, Goma Fada nomad

cards.name: Pitchburn Devils
cards.text: When Pitchburn Devils dies, it deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor: The ingenuity of goblins, the depravity of demons, and the smarts of sheep.

cards.name: Plagued Rusalka
cards.text: {B}, Sacrifice a creature: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Look at her, once filled with innocence. Death has a way of wringing away such . . . deficiencies."
—Savra

cards.name: Plated Seastrider
cards.flavor: The Neurok buried entangling cables just under the Quicksilver Sea. One seastrider harvest can provide an army's worth of armor and shields.

cards.name: Plea for Power
cards.text: Will of the council — Starting with you, each player votes for time or knowledge. If time gets more votes, take an extra turn after this one. If knowledge gets more votes or the vote is tied, draw three cards.

cards.name: Plummet
cards.text: Destroy target creature with flying.
cards.flavor:
"Let nothing own the skies but the wind."
—Dejara, Giltwood druid

cards.name: Power of Fire
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: This creature deals 1 damage to target creature or player."
cards.flavor: The cinders believe their flame was stolen by one they call the Extinguisher. All who now wield fire draw their desperate wrath.

cards.name: Power Play
cards.text:
(Start the game with this conspiracy face up in the command zone.)
You are the starting player. If multiple players would be the starting player, one of those players is chosen at random.

cards.name: Predator's Howl
cards.text:
Put a 2/2 green Wolf creature token onto the battlefield.
Morbid — Put three 2/2 green Wolf creature tokens onto the battlefield instead if a creature died this turn.
cards.flavor:
"And Muzzio says my arguments have no teeth."
—Selvala, ranger of the Lowlands

cards.name: Pride Guardian
cards.text:
Defender
Whenever Pride Guardian blocks, you gain 3 life.
cards.flavor: "Any hotheaded cub can raise a sword in anger."

cards.name: Pristine Angel
cards.text:
Flying
As long as Pristine Angel is untapped, it has protection from artifacts and from all colors.
Whenever you cast a spell, you may untap Pristine Angel.

cards.name: Provoke
cards.text:
Untap target creature you don't control. That creature blocks this turn if able.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Never start a fight you can't finish."
—Padril, council guardian

cards.name: Quag Vampires
cards.text:
Multikicker {1}{B} (You may pay an additional {1}{B} any number of times as you cast this spell.)
Swampwalk
Quag Vampires enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each time it was kicked.

cards.name: Quicksand
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Quicksand: Target attacking creature without flying gets -1/-2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Not all deaths are etched with mythic meaning and iconic glory.

cards.name: Realm Seekers
cards.text:
Realm Seekers enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it, where X is the total number of cards in all players' hands.
{2}{G}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Realm Seekers: Search your library for a land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Reckless Scholar
cards.text: {T}: Target player draws a card, then discards a card.
cards.flavor: "Any good prospector must sift the gold from the sand."

cards.name: Reckless Spite
cards.text: Destroy two target nonblack creatures. You lose 5 life.
cards.flavor: "The end is justified in being mean. Or something like that."

cards.name: Reflecting Pool
cards.text: {T}: Add to your mana pool one mana of any type that a land you control could produce.
cards.flavor: Does it reflect the future that once was or the past that can never be?

cards.name: Reign of the Pit
cards.text: Each player sacrifices a creature. Put an X/X black Demon creature token with flying onto the battlefield, where X is the total power of the creatures sacrificed this way.

cards.name: Reito Lantern
cards.text: {3}: Put target card from a graveyard on the bottom of its owner's library.
cards.flavor: Lanterns carved from the mystic stones of the Reito Mines were said to light the way of lost souls.

cards.name: Relic Crush
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment and up to one other target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor: There are many ruins, but there used to be many more.

cards.name: Respite
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn. You gain 1 life for each attacking creature.
cards.flavor: "If they board us we're finished," warned Orim. Crovax nodded. "And if they don't . . . what then?"

cards.name: Reya Dawnbringer
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.flavor: "You have not died until I consent."

cards.name: Rousing of Souls
cards.text: Parley — Each player reveals the top card of his or her library. For each nonland card revealed this way, you put a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield. Then each player draws a card.
cards.flavor: "We remember. We rise."

cards.name: Rout
cards.text:
You may cast Rout any time you could cast an instant if you pay {2} more to cast it.
Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"End this. What I seek is far greater."
—Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite

cards.name: Runed Servitor
cards.text: When Runed Servitor dies, each player draws a card.
cards.flavor: Scholars had puzzled for centuries over the ruins at Tal Terig. Its secrets had always lived within one rune-carved head.

cards.name: Sakura-Tribe Elder
cards.text: Sacrifice Sakura-Tribe Elder: Search your library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Slain warriors were buried with a tree sapling, so they would become a part of the forest after death.

cards.name: Scaled Wurm
cards.flavor: The wurms become so big, a single scale can be used as a roof for a human dwelling.

cards.name: Scourge of the Throne
cards.text:
Flying
Dethrone (Whenever this creature attacks the player with the most life or tied for most life, put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
Whenever Scourge of the Throne attacks for the first time each turn, if it's attacking the player with the most life or tied for most life, untap all attacking creatures. After this phase, there is an additional combat phase.

cards.name: Screaming Seahawk
cards.text:
Flying
When Screaming Seahawk enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a card named Screaming Seahawk, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

cards.name: Secret Summoning
cards.text:
Hidden agenda (Start the game with this conspiracy face down in the command zone and secretly name a card. You may turn this conspiracy face up any time and reveal the chosen name.)
Whenever a creature with the chosen name enters the battlefield under your control, you may search your library for any number of cards with that name, reveal them, put them into your hand, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Secrets of Paradise
cards.text:
Hidden agenda (Start the game with this conspiracy face down in the command zone and secretly name a card. You may turn this conspiracy face up any time and reveal the chosen name.)
Creatures you control with the chosen name have "{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."

cards.name: Selvala's Charge
cards.text: Parley — Each player reveals the top card of his or her library. For each nonland card revealed this way, you put a 3/3 green Elephant creature token onto the battlefield. Then each player draws a card.
cards.flavor: Selvala's arrival never goes unnoticed.

cards.name: Selvala's Enforcer
cards.text: Parley — When Selvala's Enforcer enters the battlefield, each player reveals the top card of his or her library. For each nonland card revealed this way, put a +1/+1 counter on Selvala's Enforcer. Then each player draws a card.

cards.name: Selvala, Explorer Returned
cards.text: Parley — {T}: Each player reveals the top card of his or her library. For each nonland card revealed this way, add {G} to your mana pool and you gain 1 life. Then each player draws a card.
cards.flavor: "The Lowlands refuse to suffer at the whims of the High City."

cards.name: Sentinel Dispatch
cards.text:
(Start the game with this conspiracy face up in the command zone.)
At the beginning of the first upkeep, put a 1/1 colorless Construct artifact creature token with defender onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
"Unusual. Security also worth stealing."
—Dack Fayden

cards.name: Shoreline Ranger
cards.text:
Flying
Islandcycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for an Island card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)

cards.name: Silent Arbiter
cards.text:
No more than one creature can attack each combat.
No more than one creature can block each combat.
cards.flavor: Scholars say that arbiters exist on every world, created by an unknown hand to enforce justice.

cards.name: Silverchase Fox
cards.text: {1}{W}, Sacrifice Silverchase Fox: Exile target enchantment.
cards.flavor:
"Be careful in your hunt. The clever little creature can steal your wards and lead you right into the werewolf's den."
—Britta, midwife of Gatstaf

cards.name: Skeletal Scrying
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Skeletal Scrying, exile X cards from your graveyard.
You draw X cards and you lose X life.
cards.flavor: His family was a small price to pay for the dark gifts that called to him.

cards.name: Skitter of Lizards
cards.text:
Multikicker {1}{R} (You may pay an additional {1}{R} any number of times as you cast this spell.)
Haste
Skitter of Lizards enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each time it was kicked.

cards.name: Sky Spirit
cards.text: Flying, first strike
cards.flavor:
"Like a strain of music: easy to remember but impossible to catch."
—Mirri of the Weatherlight

cards.name: Smallpox
cards.text: Each player loses 1 life, discards a card, sacrifices a creature, then sacrifices a land.
cards.flavor: Take away a few things, and a rebellion may ensue. Take away everything, and the oppression will be accepted as fate.

cards.name: Soulcatcher
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever a creature with flying dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Soulcatcher.
cards.flavor: "Their spirits walk the winds and fill my soul."

cards.name: Spectral Searchlight
cards.text: {T}: Choose a player. That player adds one mana of any color he or she chooses to his or her mana pool.
cards.flavor: The first searchlights were given as gifts, symbols of cooperation, to the emissaries present at the signing of the Guildpact.

cards.name: Spiritmonger
cards.text:
Whenever Spiritmonger deals damage to a creature, put a +1/+1 counter on Spiritmonger.
{B}: Regenerate Spiritmonger.
{G}: Spiritmonger becomes the color of your choice until end of turn.

cards.name: Split Decision
cards.text: Will of the council — Choose target instant or sorcery spell. Starting with you, each player votes for denial or duplication. If denial gets more votes, counter the spell. If duplication gets more votes or the vote is tied, copy the spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.

cards.name: Spontaneous Combustion
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Spontaneous Combustion, sacrifice a creature.
Spontaneous Combustion deals 3 damage to each creature.
cards.flavor: "Heat of battle" is usually a metaphor.

cards.name: Sporecap Spider
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor:
"They don't move much, but then again, if you get caught in its web, it has all the time in the world to get to you."
—Saidah, Joraga hunter

cards.name: Squirrel Nest
cards.text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{T}: Put a 1/1 green Squirrel creature token onto the battlefield."
cards.flavor: In the treetops, unseen by many, lurks chittering, skittering death.

cards.name: Stasis Cell
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
{3}{U}: Attach Stasis Cell to target creature.
cards.flavor: The Simic created the cells to preserve their experiments. The Azorius put the cells to use on the guilty.

cards.name: Stave Off
cards.text: Target creature gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Just a moment of perfect grace and sanctity is enough."
—Kal Lior, leonin elder

cards.name: Stifle
cards.text: Counter target activated or triggered ability. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)
cards.flavor:
"Superior force meets woefully inadequate object. What paradox were you expecting?"
—Azguri, archmage of Evos Isle

cards.name: Stronghold Discipline
cards.text: Each player loses 1 life for each creature he or she controls.
cards.flavor: In Urborg, the instigators of each new rebellion are soaked in the blood of the last.

cards.name: Sulfuric Vortex
cards.text:
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Sulfuric Vortex deals 2 damage to that player.
If a player would gain life, that player gains no life instead.

cards.name: Swords to Plowshares
cards.text: Exile target creature. Its controller gains life equal to its power.
cards.flavor: The smallest seed of regret can bloom into redemption.

cards.name: Syphon Soul
cards.text: Syphon Soul deals 2 damage to each other player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.
cards.flavor: As Phage drank their energy, a vague memory of Jeska stirred. Then she lost herself again in the joy of her victims' suffering.

cards.name: Terastodon
cards.text: When Terastodon enters the battlefield, you may destroy up to three target noncreature permanents. For each permanent put into a graveyard this way, its controller puts a 3/3 green Elephant creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Torch Fiend
cards.text: {R}, Sacrifice Torch Fiend: Destroy target artifact.
cards.flavor: Devils redecorate every room with fire.

cards.name: Tragic Slip
cards.text:
Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
Morbid — That creature gets -13/-13 until end of turn instead if a creature died this turn.
cards.flavor: Linger on death's door and risk being invited in.

cards.name: Traveler's Cloak
cards.text:
Enchant creature
As Traveler's Cloak enters the battlefield, choose a land type.
When Traveler's Cloak enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Enchanted creature has landwalk of the chosen type.

cards.name: Treasonous Ogre
cards.text:
Dethrone (Whenever this creature attacks the player with the most life or tied for most life, put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
Pay 3 life: Add {R} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor:
"Everything comes with a price. Especially revolution."
—Grenzo, dungeon warden

cards.name: Trumpet Blast
cards.text: Attacking creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Keldon warriors don't need signals to tell them when to attack. They need signals to tell them when to stop.

cards.name: Turn the Tide
cards.text: Creatures your opponents control get -2/-0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Let their mindless armies come and face the might of genius."
—Varil, Neurok partisan

cards.name: Twisted Abomination
cards.text:
{B}: Regenerate Twisted Abomination.
Swampcycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Swamp card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)

cards.name: Typhoid Rats
cards.text: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
cards.flavor: Kidnappers caught in Havengul are given two choices: languish in prison or become rat catchers. The smart ones go to prison.

cards.name: Tyrant's Choice
cards.text: Will of the council — Starting with you, each player votes for death or torture. If death gets more votes, each opponent sacrifices a creature. If torture gets more votes or the vote is tied, each opponent loses 4 life.

cards.name: Uncontrollable Anger
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and attacks each turn if able.

cards.name: Unexpected Potential
cards.text:
Hidden agenda (Start the game with this conspiracy face down in the command zone and secretly name a card. You may turn this conspiracy face up any time and reveal the chosen name.)
You may spend mana as though it were mana of any color to cast spells with the chosen name.

cards.name: Unhallowed Pact
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, return that card to the battlefield under your control.
cards.flavor: Agreements with demons seldom end at the grave.

cards.name: Unquestioned Authority
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Unquestioned Authority enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Enchanted creature has protection from creatures.
cards.flavor: After Gideon cleansed the Ninth District, none of the ganglords challenged the Boros.

cards.name: Valor Made Real
cards.text: Target creature can block any number of creatures this turn.
cards.flavor: "As my father taught, ‘Training will raise your shield to the blow, but courage fills the gaps the shield leaves open.'"

cards.name: Vampire Hexmage
cards.text:
First strike
Sacrifice Vampire Hexmage: Remove all counters from target permanent.
cards.flavor: When the blood hunt lost its thrill, she looked for less tangible means of domination.

cards.name: Vedalken Orrery
cards.text: You may cast nonland cards as though they had flash.
cards.flavor: The model incorporated the fifth sun effortlessly, as if it had always known.

cards.name: Vent Sentinel
cards.text:
Defender
{1}{R}, {T}: Vent Sentinel deals damage to target player equal to the number of creatures with defender you control.
cards.flavor:
"Zendikar fortifies itself against the Great Threat, making sentries of sky, sea, and stone."
—The War Diaries

cards.name: Victimize
cards.text: Choose two target creature cards in your graveyard. Sacrifice a creature. If you do, return the chosen cards to the battlefield tapped.
cards.flavor:
"Die. But die knowing that your pathetic life will yield a great bounty for me."
—Zul Ashur, lich lord

cards.name: Volcanic Fallout
cards.text:
Volcanic Fallout can't be countered.
Volcanic Fallout deals 2 damage to each creature and each player.
cards.flavor:
"How can we outrun the sky?"
—Hadran, sunseeder of Naya

cards.name: Vow of Duty
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2, has vigilance, and can't attack you or a planeswalker you control.
cards.flavor:
"I prefer loyalty to be a matter of respect, not of magic. But one does what one must."
—Kaalia of the Vast

cards.name: Wakedancer
cards.text: Morbid — When Wakedancer enters the battlefield, if a creature died this turn, put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Hers is an ancient form of necromancy, steeped in shamanic trance and ritual that few skaberen or ghoulcallers comprehend.

cards.name: Wakestone Gargoyle
cards.text:
Defender, flying
{1}{W}: Creatures you control with defender can attack this turn as though they didn't have defender.
cards.flavor: Its pulsating cry shatters bonds of iron, granite, and servitude.

cards.name: Warmonger's Chariot
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +2/+2.
As long as equipped creature has defender, it can attack as though it didn't have defender.
Equip {3} ({3}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)
cards.flavor: The best defense is a good offense.

cards.name: Whispergear Sneak
cards.text:
Draft Whispergear Sneak face up.
During the draft, you may turn Whispergear Sneak face down. If you do, look at any unopened booster pack in the draft or any booster pack not being looked at by another player.
cards.flavor: Spy for today. Plan for tomorrow.

cards.name: Wind Dancer
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Take my hand and dance to the music of the winds."

cards.name: Wolfbriar Elemental
cards.text:
Multikicker {G} (You may pay an additional {G} any number of times as you cast this spell.)
When Wolfbriar Elemental enters the battlefield, put a 2/2 green Wolf creature token onto the battlefield for each time it was kicked.

cards.name: Wood Sage
cards.text: {T}: Name a creature card. Reveal the top four cards of your library and put all of them with that name into your hand. Put the rest into your graveyard.

cards.name: Woodvine Elemental
cards.text:
Trample
Parley — Whenever Woodvine Elemental attacks, each player reveals the top card of his or her library. For each nonland card revealed this way, attacking creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn. Then each player draws a card.

cards.name: Worldknit
cards.text:
(Start the game with this conspiracy face up in the command zone.)
As long as every card in your card pool started the game in your library or in the command zone, lands you control have "{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."

cards.name: Wrap in Flames
cards.text: Wrap in Flames deals 1 damage to each of up to three target creatures. Those creatures can't block this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Our pyromancer's flames may not have killed them, but they bought us the time we needed."
—The War Diaries

cards.name: Wrap in Vigor
cards.text: Regenerate each creature you control.
cards.flavor: Some nature mages unknowingly took advantage of the temporal energies still swirling on Dominaria. What they mistook for healing magic was in fact the manipulation of time.

cards.name: Zombie Goliath
cards.flavor:
"Removing the encumbrance of useless brain tissue grants several advantages: a slight increase in mobility, a response of revulsion and horror from the enemy, and, in the case of large specimens, room for passengers."
—Zul Ashur, lich lord
